manifest_description.message: Shows you what kind of link you are going to click on.

settings_popup_install.message: Link Alert has been installed. Please, take a look at the Preferences!

settings_popup_update.message: Link Alert has been updated. Please, take a look at the Changelog to find out what's new!

settings_content_preferences_showBox.message: Draw a box around the icons to make it look like a tooltip

settings_content_preferences_noTitle.message: Remove the title attribute from the links

settings_content_preferences_keepZoom.message: Don't resize the icons on page zoom

settings_content_preferences_blacklistOn.message: Disable extension on the following sites:

settings_content_preferences_blacklistEd.message: Don't you know how to use the blacklist? Take a look at the Help section!

settings_content_protocols_viewSource.message: Web page in source code mode

settings_content_attributes_onClick.message: Links having mouse left click event handlers

settings_content_howToUse_reload.message: After installation you have to reload open pages to make Link Alert work. You also have to reload open pages to see changes if you modify the settings.

settings_content_howToUse_smartPosition.message: If you enable "Smart position" the extension will calculate the available space on the right side of the mouse cursor and put the icons to the left side if there is not enough space. If you disable this option, the icons will be placed to the right side of the cursor every time, but they may float out of the visible area.

settings_content_howToUse_blacklist.message:
To add certain sites to the blacklist, put every URL into a new line! You can use an asterisk to block a whole domain. For example:
Disable Link Alert on this article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opera_browser
Disable Link Alert on the whole english Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org*

settings_content_performance_lag.message: Link Alert can lag on certain (heavy scripted) sites. If you find it disturbing, add the address to the blacklist!

settings_content_notes_howItWorks.message: Link Alert listens only to the actual links appearing in the source code, and does not send any request to the linked page! For example, a link can point to a pdf file without mentioning anything about it in the URL. It can not be catched this way, so you will not see any sign of it.

settings_content_notes_operaPolicy.message: According to Opera's policy, extensions don't work on internal browser pages like settings, history or this page.

settings_content_credits_createdBy.message: Link Alert is created by Robert Toth.

settings_content_credits_inspiredBy.message: This extension was inspired by the LinkAlert userscript.

settings_content_credits_copyCode.message: Besides my own coding I use some layout and style from the internal pages made by Opera Software ASA.

settings_content_credits_thanks.message: Thanks for every contributor! <em>(See the changelog for details!)

settings_content_warning_notResponsible.message: This extension was not made by Opera Software ASA. The company is not responsible for any of the errors.

settings_content_license_share.message: You can share this extension, but I ask you to link the download page instead of copying the NEX file.

settings_content_license_copy.message: You can copy and modify the code of this extension as long as it's free and you use the proper credits.

settings_content_permissions_tabs.message: Link Alert needs permission to access your tabs only to open the settings page when the extension is installed or updated.

settings_content_permissions_data.message: Link Alert needs permission to access your data on all websites to analyze links.
